name: page_object_model
description: Page Object Model pattern for maintainable UI tests

args: class LoginPage: def __init__(self, driver): self.driver = driver; self.username_field = ('id', 'username'); self.password_field = ('id', 'password'); self.submit_button = ('id', 'submit'); def login(self, username, password): print(f'Logging in as {username}'); return True; page = LoginPage(None); result = page.login('user@test.com', 'password'); print(f'Login result: {result}'); print('Page Object Model pattern demonstrated')

expected_output.example:
Logging in as user@test.com
Login result: True
Page Object Model pattern demonstrated

POM class structure

args: class BasePage: def __init__(self, driver): self.driver = driver; def find_element(self, locator): print(f'Finding element: {locator}'); return f'Element-{locator[1]}'; class HomePage(BasePage): @property; def search_box(self): return self.find_element(('css', '.search')); def search(self, query): print(f'Searching for: {query}'); return True; page = HomePage(None); page.search('test query'); print('Inheritance in Page Objects')

expected_output.example:
Searching for: test query
Inheritance in Page Objects

Base page with shared methods

args: from dataclasses import dataclass; @dataclass; class Locators: username = ('id', 'user'); password = ('id', 'pass'); submit = ('css', 'button[type="submit"]'); class LoginPage: locators = Locators(); def fill_username(self, text): print(f'Filling username: {text}'); def fill_password(self, text): print(f'Filling password: {text}'); def click_submit(self): print('Clicking submit'); page = LoginPage(); page.fill_username('test'); page.fill_password('pass'); page.click_submit(); print('Locators separated from actions')

expected_output.example:
Filling username: test
Filling password: pass
Clicking submit
Locators separated from actions

Locator strategy pattern
